meanings.sent1: The besmoked room smelled of burnt wood.
meanings.sent2: The old fireplace was besmoked from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The besmoked curtains made the room look mysterious.
meanings.sent4: The besmoked sky at sunset painted a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The besmoked walls reminded me of a cozy cabin in the woods.

meanings.definition: To fill or cover with smoke.
meanings.sent1: The chef besmoked the meat to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent2: The campfire besmoked the entire clearing with its fragrant scent.
meanings.sent3: The magician besmoked the stage before performing his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The factory chimney besmoked the sky, creating a haze over the city.
meanings.sent5: The barbecue grill besmoked the backyard, signaling a delicious meal ahead.
